subject: Re: How to create a dynamic form for Junit test.
msgSnippet: ... code ... Thanks for your reply. Actually, it has no problem to expand  concrete class to the interface for method. But if it have other
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Carfield Yim" <carfield@...> wrote:
>
> > It seems OK. But I have to modified the constructor of EditUser to
> > satisfy this operation -it is unacceptable for me to change source
code
> > for writing Junit test cases.
> >
> Why?? I fact I also do that... what is the problem of doing that?
>

Thanks for your
reply. Actually, it has no problem to expand\
 concrete class to the interface for method.
But if it have other approaches
to do that, no requred for code changes \
should be better. 
(The superclasses' constructors should be adjusted also.)

Last week, I considered if I can get the dynamic form through
MockStrutsTestCase, the class provide a method getActionForm(). 

Then
setRequestPathInfo( ... );
setConfigFIle( ... );
actionPerform();
MyDynamicForm dynamicForm = (MyDynamicForm)getActionForm();

So I can change the dynamicForm to satisfy my testing requirements.

It not required my source code change. . .

Regards&Thanks.

-Hut
